website_summaries.verdict: Featuring a crunchy and sweet formula that naturally inquisitive parrots love chomping their way through, Nutri-Berries are a fun way to ensure that your big bird gets the vitamins, minerals, and fatty acids they need.
pros: Proso millet, corn, oats, peanuts, canary seed, and red millet are the first 6 ingredients
cons: An appetizing, yet fairly expensive parrot food
You may save money by buying in bulk

customer_reviews.title: Lafaber's wasn't the issue, the supplier IS....don't buy from online Petco products they are stale!
customer_reviews.text: I'd never buy anything from Petco again...I can't trust their bird food products as much as I love Lafaber's whose quality is consistently good, but buying a huge container and getting it smelling stale like the product had sat way over its fresh date, and I couldn't trust it to be nutritious for my Grey. I didn't spend a lot of money and raise this parrot for him to eat garbage products. I will find another dealer or go to Petsmart who've never sold me anything bad smelling. Toss this stuff its not worth seeing if Andy gets sick or if its just the odor.
customer_reviews.author: Gael

customer_reviews.title: DISGUSTING!  Full of moths and larvae.
customer_reviews.text: Purchase was made in early May 2018. Label on box says "Best before 6/11/19." It's now Sept. 2018 and the food is FULL OF LARVAE AND MOTHS! Now I know why our African Grey- who has always been fed this dry food in addition to lots of other food choices- has refused to eat it. Lefeber makes quality food for pet birds. Just DON'T BUY FROM THIS SELLER!
customer_reviews.author: Whisker's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know if it’s old, counterfeit or was just stored improperly. There were few “berries”. The majority is an impenetrable mass I can’t chisel out. I guess the moths are bonus proteins? They are all over my house and we’re not happy. I’ve bought this brand before and NEVER had a problem like this. Something is very wrong here.
customer_reviews.author: kathyrob

customer_reviews.title: My first box of this seed was great. Unfortunately the second delivery was very disappointing
customer_reviews.text: My first box of this seed was great. Unfortunately the second delivery was very disappointing. The seed inside where mostly pulverized and no longer in small ball form. The small ball form is the main reason i like this product. because of this and the inconsistency of the product Im giving it a poor review. This stuff isn't cheap. I also wrote a complaint to amazon hoping to return and swap it out for another box BUT NEVER heard anything back...
customer_reviews.author: KTD

customer_reviews.title: This order was a disappointment and a waist of my money.
customer_reviews.text: This order was a huge disappointment! When I opened the container it was a solid mass in the shape of the bucket it came in. When I tried to loosen it up it just crumbled in my hands. I order this product once every 30 to 45 days. My African Gray refuses to go through the day without them. He won’t eat the crumbs. He wants to hold the ball while he nibbles on it. There is a lot of waist in a good bucket but it is hard to accept an order that is 50% crumbs before I even give it to my bird. I don’t often submit a review but this order compelled me to do so.
customer_reviews.author: Shelly Rich

customer_reviews.title: Try a smaller Purchase first-totally a waste of money!
customer_reviews.text: I always read reviews from other customers. The feedback was great. However my Eclectus turned her beak up on these. I had purchased auto-delivery. Only If I'd caught this earlier ....I know from past experience that AMAZON would have allowed me to return them---too late...my error! One good thing, rather then sell them on Craig's list, I made a 30 mile trek to the local PARROT RESCUE...just my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Chris A.

customer_reviews.title: Formula Changed
customer_reviews.text: Changed to formula or something. My little conure used to love love love these. The previous 3.5 tub lasted a year and he gobbled up every last bit with gusto. When we reordered we noticed that in the new batch the clusters were very soft and damp and my little guy hates them.
customer_reviews.author: LMT

customer_reviews.title: Old bird food
customer_reviews.text: I have been buying this product for over 6 years and normally I don't have an issue with the bird food. However, this container of food was all in little pieces inside the container. Some pieces were stuck together and other pieces were loose and tiny. It was not the regular size balls. I can't use it for my birds. I clicked to see if I could either return it or get a replacement, but on Amazon with this seller I can't. So I am out of the money I spent for some old bird food I can't use.
customer_reviews.author: SSR

customer_reviews.title: A Fussy Cockatoo Eats These Treats
customer_reviews.text: I give these to my conure as her main diet but I have a fussy cockatoo who won't eat anything for a treat except the nutriberries. I can get him to do anything with the promise of a nutiberry and to know that it's good for him too unlike seed treats, makes me feel good about giving them to him. All five of our parrots love them but the picky finicky cockatoo really steals the show in this review--he won't even eat grapes unless I peel them for him! But he'll eat nutriberries.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle (Michy) Devon

customer_reviews.title: My Amazon grey loves this food.
customer_reviews.text: This company is owned by a veterinarian that specializes in parrots. No wonder my parrot loves this food. Plus it has all the proper vitamins and minerals my kind of bird needs to stay healthy and happy. I signed up with “Lafeber Pet Birds” also and now I get emails with wonderful articles about parrots and other kinds of pet birds. Lots of great information that has helped me better take care of and understand my beautiful parrot whom I love dearly. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: 2 normal people

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend these Nutri-Berries to any discerning customer
customer_reviews.text: I would recommend these Nutri-Berries to any discerning customer. I've ordered from them multiple times in the past (often for the gourmet tropical bags, etc), but having this bucket did not hurt in the slightest. My birds loved the berries offered no matter the flavor. The nutrients offered are optimal as a caged bird companion suppliment, so long as you offer fresh fruit and veggies as well. When I ran out of the classic Nutri-Berries, I have continued to use this for my Tropical Nutri-Berry packages. 5/5, as an incredibly satisfied buyer!
customer_reviews.author: Allie Kratz

customer_reviews.title: Good but can be wasteful
customer_reviews.text: My cockatoo loves these BUT he wasts SO MUCH that it's hard to keep paying for these He destroys the entire ball just to eat the few peanut pieces 😩 I do make fresh food and use these as treats or while traveling with him
customer_reviews.author: Fallon Zoe

customer_reviews.title: Best product and value for your money!
customer_reviews.text: I just ordered these for the second time in a couple of months and they came perfectly packaged and very fresh. I read some earlier reviews with bad results and some with pictures showing bugs in the container but I have not had this problem. My amazon and conures love these little treats! I will continue to purchase these through this seller Terri
customer_reviews.author: Terri H

customer_reviews.title: My parrots go to snack
customer_reviews.text: While this are a snack for parrots and not a main meal. My Timneh Grey likes them a lot. And when she keeps getting them emptying the little bags they sell. I got this big container. I freeze them to make sure there is nothing that can grow and ruin them. Thirty days will do it. And then she gets a few a day or so. Beats a lot of not so great choices IMHO.
customer_reviews.author: A. Kristie

customer_reviews.title: BEST TREAT BALLS EVER
customer_reviews.text: Our birds love these treat balls! Our vet highly recommend these instead of just seed and our feathered children just can't get enough of them. Now I've seen these other post about mold or bugs getting into the treats and I'm willing to bet it's because they have a dirty house and have a ton of humidity. We've been buying these for years with absolutely no problems. These are an excellent source of nutrition for our birbs
customer_reviews.author: D H

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: These nutriberries did not seem fresh. They were very small and seemed that the container had been mishandled. They were mostly broken in pieces. They were not like any I had purchased before and I have been purchasing them for over 20 years from different sellers. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Virginia Tokar

customer_reviews.title: My Parrots LOVE These!
customer_reviews.text: I have two Amazons who are picky eaters. Most of their diet is a good-quality pellet and fresh chop. For treats they love LoVe LOVE these Nutri-Berries! They prefer the original to the fruity ones, but they also prefer vegtables to fruit. I use them for treats so they don't get too many oily seeds in their diet, but I highly recommend these!
customer_reviews.author: D. HILL

customer_reviews.title: Happy Senegal
customer_reviews.text: My sweet 26 year old Senegal parrot loves these, and has along with a healthy pellet diet for the 22 years I’ve been owned by her. She gets 3 “birdie balls” each morning with her pellets, along with one placed on top her cage to work in for extra stimulation. I would highly recommend these as she is happy each day to get her treats and looks and acts like a happy, healthy young bird.
customer_reviews.author: dawninMA

customer_reviews.title: Healthy and Tasty
customer_reviews.text: My parrots have been eating these for years. They are, without a doubt, my favorite food for them. They love them and would eat them exclusively if I would allow that. The only down side is the price. They have always been expensive. I would be three times as many if they had a better price point.
customer_reviews.author: Jorie West

customer_reviews.title: Classical nutriberries in a huge container... Very nice for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bucket because I was tired of running to the shop to buy more bags for my little babies. Aparently this is the classical product they came up with, it's not as tasty or sweet as the specialty flavors they offer in bags, but it's the same concept (and probably healthier, that's why I got them too). My parrots like them fine, I don't really think they feel the difference. Much cheaper option. Everything came fine, no melted balls or anything like what I have seen here. I have to say that the product was very well packed and properly sealed and I am very satisfied. I will reorder more.
customer_reviews.author: AliM

customer_reviews.title: Comes quickly and a good price
customer_reviews.text: Our two green cheeks love these. We call them cookies and they get them twice a day. They can be had for a cheaper price other places but you have to buy huge quantities and if you leave them out they develop bugs. Keeping in freezer helps but they take up allot of space in the freezer. If you are only feeding a couple birds this is the best bet.
customer_reviews.author: Mary E. Johnston

customer_reviews.title: Fresh
customer_reviews.text: I have to give this a 5 even though my Love Bird isn't crazy about it. It arrived in whole nuggets and appears fresh. However, my Love Bird just doesn't seem to like it that much. I just tried breaking it apart to see if it would be more appealing for him. We'll see.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Un safe bird food
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy from this seller. The safety seal was not on the container of bird food. I can not feed this to my bird. Who know what has happened to it. I am know out $31.00 . I did not know this could not be returned. Very unhappy with this seller.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Woods

customer_reviews.title: My Meyer's parrot loved the Nutri-Berries and I have some left over
customer_reviews.text: My Meyer's parrot loved the Nutri-Berries and I have some left over. November 18th was the day he passed away of a respiratory problem. I miss him incredibly. He was my companion and would kiss me when I said Bissou. I treated him as though he were human. His name was Mikey and was only 1 1/2 years old. This parrot's life span is usually 25 years. I hoped we would live a long and healthy life together.
customer_reviews.author: jane cerutti

customer_reviews.title: ... seems to be a healthy parrot food and is recommended by my bird vet for my small Amazon "Mexican ...
customer_reviews.text: This seems to be a healthy parrot food and is recommended by my bird vet for my small Amazon "Mexican Red-headed" parrot. But the shipments have been terrible - container thrown in a bare box or with one piece of packing so that the food balls are crushed into small fragments and loose seeds and/or smashed together into a sticky mass by the time they arrive. Very disappointing and a waste of expensive food.
customer_reviews.author: C. L. H.

customer_reviews.title: Nice try, but parrots too smart for it!
customer_reviews.text: Great idea to glue complete nutrition together, but my African Grey has no trouble taking it apart, eating what she likes and leaving the rest behind. It is thus not much better than complete seed mixes. I have to break it up and mix it in hot cereal, just like pelleted food, or mashed sweet potato to get her to eat nutritionally complete diet
customer_reviews.author: Kira Schofield

customer_reviews.title: NOT THE FRESHEST !
customer_reviews.text: The bottom half of the container had all the berries mostly melted together. Obviously didn't find this out until top half was used up. Must have encountered some heated conditions in it's travels. Will look elsewhere for future purchases.
customer_reviews.author: William Surovic

customer_reviews.title: My parrot loves these and they are great in foraging toys.
customer_reviews.text: My parrot loves these. Great for adding to regular diet and keeping the variety of foods interesting. I keep the container in the fridge to keep them fresh and the container is great for that use (though you don't have to keep them in the fridge). I use them in foraging toys and he will work hard to get to them. Great mental exercise to keep him occupied and happy. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: SPTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: My bird has grown up on these. Her daily treat.
customer_reviews.text: She’s healthy and about 15 now? This is her daily treat even though it’s actually a fully balanced diet. She LOVES THEM! Love the large size container - but would really love it if we could switch away from the plastic with refill bags.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Rose

customer_reviews.title: Sprouting feathers.
customer_reviews.text: Gracie, our Blue Fronted Amazon loves them! The product arrived quickly, as described, and she thinks they are delicious. Honestly, I could probably eat them too as everything is hulled 😂.
customer_reviews.author: Sunshine Mama

customer_reviews.title: These are a GREAT treat! Goes a long way AND HEALTHY
customer_reviews.text: Love the new ziplock packaging! Use to be a plastic container, & I only have a GCC towards the end smelt rancid. My bird thinks these are great treats keeps one foot busy and takes a while to consume! Mutiplier purchases, yes!
customer_reviews.author: Jane

customer_reviews.title: My older bird loves these
customer_reviews.text: My older bird (45) loves these and the Nutri-berries for older birds so I give him both. They are the first thing he eats. He takes them out of his nut bowl and puts them in a line. They are his favorite.
customer_reviews.author: Whoa Nellie!

customer_reviews.title: produce smells different, parrot won't eat it
customer_reviews.text: Our parrot loved this, but won't touch it now. It seems funny and bird won't go near the dish if it's in it. really disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Marguerite C. Thibeau

customer_reviews.title: African Gray LOVES this!
customer_reviews.text: My African Gray is a rescue & a very picky eater. He LOVES these NutriBerries. They arrived fresh, no bugs or larva. Will definitely buy the 20lb box next.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly S.

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: About 3-4 pounds was just crumbs that my bird won’t eat. The rest was stuck together like it had been wet and had to be separated
customer_reviews.author: MEEKO

customer_reviews.title: Parrot loves 'em
customer_reviews.text: My parrot is a very finicky eater; and she loves these little morsels. Plus, they are nutritious. That's what counts. However, they are rather pricey. But, she's my 'child', so it's worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Phyllis Adler

customer_reviews.title: sorry my bird did not like it
customer_reviews.text: I do not know if it is a great product or not. I even feel a little bit out out of place to rate it but my bird - cockatoo - tried one and that was it.
customer_reviews.author: Pierre TinelTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: African Grey will only eat the millet.
customer_reviews.text: As the title says, my Grey will only eat the millet. The rest languishes in the bottom of the cage until cleaned up.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely LOVE Nutriberries, but not as much as my bird
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely LOVE Nutriberries, but not as much as my bird. I've been giving my bird Nutriberries since the 90's, and she still loves them. All of the birds I've been involved with throughout my life have (budgies, Parakeets, conures, grey's and amazons). It's a good part of a varied diet, and the birds don't seem to get tired of them. I was really happy when they started introducing the different varieties.
customer_reviews.author: Tyna

customer_reviews.title: Good for African Grays and White capped pionus parrots.
customer_reviews.text: Birds like them, I alternate the spicy with parrot size, the two different fruity flavors, macaw size nuggets, and the veggie, so they have something different every day other than all the regular people food they get. On sundays, I give them one of each of all the other flavors. My birds are an African Gray, and a white capped pionus. Nutriberries are what I leave in their cage for snacks on off hours, when they're not getting their regular meals of 'people food' with the rest of the family.
customer_reviews.author: The_Nightfly

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Been feeding my yellow naped Amazon this for over two years. He loves it and has kept a great weight and we love all the flavor variety’s in the treats.
customer_reviews.author: Barb L

customer_reviews.title: Great Value, Parrot Loves it
customer_reviews.text: My parrot loves these! He is a conure, not a cockatiel, but nonetheless he loves the variety of seeds and the need to forage. Not only that, but you get a TON of food for the cost. This size tub of food lasts me about 4 months, for a fraction of the price of a bag of pellets this size. Currently, I’ve been using this bird food for my parrot for 4 years now, and I don’t see myself ever needing to switch!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: By Pionus parrots love it
customer_reviews.text: I love the reasonable price I get by ordering 20 lbs of Nutri-Berries at a time. The 'berries' are well packed in layers, with clear, plastic spacers, every 3 or 4 inches to keep the bottom berries from getting crushed. Unfortunately, there still are a lot of loose seeds at the bottom of the carton. As far as the 'nutri' part of the food, my birds have always had a clean slate of health from their vet. So, they seem to be getting all the nutrition they need. Thankfully, since one of my birds will ONLY eat Lafeber's Nutri-Berries.
customer_reviews.author: Peter LTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: "Yummy yummy," as my parrot is fond of saying
customer_reviews.text: My Senegal Parrot absolutely loves these. I used to get the more fruity ones, but he seems to finish these more whereas I would find the others half eaten on the floor. These are also great because he likes to take his food up to the top of his cage to eat, and these last long enough that he can stay up there and enjoy them for awhile. I've also noticed that he doesn't dip these in water as he does most of his food so maybe that means they are easier for him to digest. Either way, he loves them.
customer_reviews.author: Kym

customer_reviews.title: African Grey
customer_reviews.text: She loves it!!! That's all I care about: it's good for her and she eats it. Along with a few sunflower seeds and some raw steak, now and then, we've got a healthy diet and a healthy bird.
customer_reviews.author: Bubbledeboo

customer_reviews.title: Fresh, fast & fairly priced
customer_reviews.text: After seeing some reviews of old product, I was slightly apprehensive, but these are so nice and fresh! My sun conure adores these. She gets one every morning as we breakfast together.
customer_reviews.author: HelenMS

customer_reviews.title: Well the birds love it. I generally burry these under pelleted food ...
customer_reviews.text: Well the birds love it. I generally burry these under pelleted food and flax seed so that it is a treat that they must search for. I have noticed that they are picking it out before all the other food which means they like it, I do feel that it is healthier than other options out there especially if you have pellet picky eaters ( which I do). I would recommend supplementing veggies and other items in to diversify their diets and don't over feed on seeds as this product has enough in there already.
customer_reviews.author: Desert Flower

customer_reviews.title: My parrot likes it!
customer_reviews.text: I don't know about the flavor, it's bird food and apparently it is good because my parrot seems to like it very much.
customer_reviews.author: T. N. M.

customer_reviews.title: Lots of treats for you money.
customer_reviews.text: This tub is huge and it comes with a plastic film seal so its fresh during shipping. The pet stores charge almost the same for a tiny bag by comparison.
customer_reviews.author: Luke and Megan Skorniakoff

customer_reviews.title: My Parrot Loves These!
customer_reviews.text: Mt parrot goes crazy for these seed balls! They are an awesome way to add some fun to his diet and still keep it healthy.
customer_reviews.author: Terrianne Neill

customer_reviews.title: My Grey does not like the very small seeds
customer_reviews.text: My Grey took about 2 weeks to get used to this balls of very little seeds but now does not care for Lafeber's nutri berries.. She nibbles on them but the seeds are very, very small. It is more of a play thing rather than a food. This will be the last tub I buy since my Grey apparently is not liking the very small seeds.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence A Team

customer_reviews.title: The packaging seems like a waste of plastic
customer_reviews.text: My green checked amazon loves these things. I prefer to buy these traditional Nutri-Berries in the plastic tub. The packaging seems like a waste of plastic, but it protects the product well. The varieties that come in bags end up crushed. My bird really likes to hold on to the berries while eating them, so the more whole berries the better. They make a great "hush birdy" treat to occupy my parrot when he decides to serenade the house with screams.
customer_reviews.author: Lake

customer_reviews.title: Great product and service
customer_reviews.text: Can’t speak to the flavor myself since I never tried one LOL. My Blue and Gold loves them. Cheaper than the pet shop and delivery is turbo fast.
customer_reviews.author: Sean M.

customer_reviews.title: Birds like it but there is one proplem.
customer_reviews.text: OK our Conures like it very much. Our Eclectus like them VERY VERY much. Our Cockatoo thinks they are OK. Overall the birds like them and get them right up. We only use them a treats. Would give them 5 stars, except there is one problem. We get moths in the container after a few months. Easy to solve, just keep the container in the freezer and take out just what you are feeding the birds for that day.
customer_reviews.author: tell family

customer_reviews.title: Greyt Product!
customer_reviews.text: Great product. My Timneh Grey loves these! I use a nutcracker and break them in 1/2 for her. She loves to take one from her dish, then scoot to her favorite perch where she then contentedly munches and gets lots of beak action with these. She does enjoy the other flavors, especially the spicier ones, but these original flavor make up the staple of her preferred foods during the day. She especially enjoys our late afternoon routine, where she sits on my shoulder as I read, and she nibbles on one of these.
customer_reviews.author: Zeeba

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: My cockatoo loves them he doesn’t eat the seeds but he loves what’s in the middle wish they made soft treats without seeds
customer_reviews.author: pat mercer

customer_reviews.title: My bird loves them
customer_reviews.text: I like the entire product line. You know it's high quality when it's produced by avian vet!
customer_reviews.author: Opaldude

customer_reviews.title: My Ekkie loves these.
customer_reviews.text: This is our go-to healthy treat for our picky 12 year old eclectus. The treats encourage foraging as your bird will break them apart and dig through the pieces to eat his favorite bits first, and if the nutrition comes close to the claims on the label, it could even serve as a daily diet for some parrot species (not eclectus though, digestive tract too long and not enough vitamin A...google it).
customer_reviews.author: MyDigitaLife

customer_reviews.title: Nooch!
customer_reviews.text: My conure freaking loves these as treats. I wouldn't feed as a staple but he is happy with a couple in the mornings :) These were fresh and cheaper than Drs. F&S and Petco. Will get them from this seller on Amazon from now on!
customer_reviews.author: Frances

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you get the right type for your bird
customer_reviews.text: We frequently got the wrong variety and stopped ordering from Amazon as a result
customer_reviews.author: LLM

customer_reviews.title: Parrot loves these!
customer_reviews.text: He crumbles them to pieces too but eventually goes back and eats the crumbs too.
customer_reviews.author: Natv

customer_reviews.title: Birds love them & they are less messy than seed.
customer_reviews.text: Glad I can buy these in a larger quantify than in the stores. These are less messy than seed and with several birds, buying them in small quantify would not make sense. My birds love these. I have been buying them for a few years now.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Close

customer_reviews.title: A wonderful treat that is nutritious
customer_reviews.text: My parrots LOVE these! Trying to keep my parrots healthy and away from "junk food" can be a challenge and these assist to offer them a perceived treat during the day while offering them nutrition. When they first arrived they were not too eager to eat them, however patience really paid off. Now I include them daily as a healthy reward. My parrots are rather large and hold them as they nibble happily. I have a mini macaw and a yellow-naped amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Straight-Talk

customer_reviews.title: perfect size for Congo Grey
customer_reviews.text: These nuggets are just under an inch in diameter and the perfect size for my Congo African Grey's grasp. She loves these.
customer_reviews.author: SLT

customer_reviews.title: Seed disguised
customer_reviews.text: This treat allows the parrots to get their favorite food item, seed. However, it is disguised in a little ball. They take delight in holding it and nibbling off the delightful goodies. It's not all seed. There are other yummy morsels combined in the concoction. I consider these an essential part of the dry mixture that I feed my parrots. (I mix various pellets, nuts, cereals, dried fruits and freeze dried veggies in a "master bucket" for my large flock.)
customer_reviews.author: Parrot Nanny

customer_reviews.title: My parrot's absolute favorite.
customer_reviews.text: My parrots default favorite. I know that parrots should be eating a pellet diet, but my baby boy just refuses to touch it though we've tried every method out there. That said. This feed is enriched with vitamins, supplement it with some daily offering of fruit and vegetable and your feathered friend should be fine. During the last vet visit we got complimented on his feathers and perfect weight. No fatty liver here, so these can't be that bad as the main course.
customer_reviews.author: ProConsumer

customer_reviews.title: I think its a great idea how they combine seeds together so the parrot ...
customer_reviews.text: My African Grey mostly grabbed them and threw it to the ground. I think its a great idea how they combine seeds together so the parrot can forge while eating, but my bird just did not like the pellets or seeds it was made from.
customer_reviews.author: John Deer

customer_reviews.title: Great parrot food
customer_reviews.text: Great food source for parrots. Has the benefit of foraging and much less waste that seeds.
customer_reviews.author: amazonnut

customer_reviews.title: Parrots like them
customer_reviews.text: My Amazon's and Grey love these. Much healthier than seeds.
customer_reviews.author: Moises

customer_reviews.title: Birds love them!
customer_reviews.text: I didn't eat any! They are handy snacks for my greedy, spoiled feather friends.
customer_reviews.author: Amazed

customer_reviews.title: Happy Parrots
customer_reviews.text: My parrots, Congo African Grey and a Vos Marie Eclectus, get 3 each as a bedtime snack. They love these! They smell good too.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product, our parrots love these as treats
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product, our parrots love these as treats. The Macaw is a bit spoiled and wasteful and only eats the peanut parts but the Eclectus loves to dissect the whole thing. Our eclectus is more intelligent than most so we give her these in a plastic bag, she works on opening it and getting to them as a foraging activity. Highly recommended though, great product and smells fresh.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: I use these, all the time and foirst time ...
customer_reviews.text: I use these, all the time and foirst time I have ordered, online, they seemed wayy too soft and many were smashed into small bits. I ended up tossing over half the tub away. Won't order-again sadly
customer_reviews.author: Pat Hakanson

customer_reviews.title: IMPORTANT INFO........CAN BE FROZEN
customer_reviews.text: I,ve used this product for years and have never been disappointed in it. Can be crushed for the smaller birds.
customer_reviews.author: debbie serenson

customer_reviews.title: Worms!
customer_reviews.text: Today I discovered worms in this product that I have been feeding to my birds for a month. Very dissatisfied that now I have to throw away the rest and waste money, but also have been using contaminated food all along. And of course the refund window is closed. Thanks for infecting my house with meal moth larvae!
customer_reviews.author: Russ

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Decent price for a gallon bucket. Midsized Cockatoo loves them. Fast shipping
customer_reviews.author: Mark Rosenmeier

customer_reviews.title: Frances frowns on These
customer_reviews.text: Our Yellow named Amazon will not eat these at all. As a matter of fact, to show her disdain, she throws them. We have tried over and over. Nope! She hates them. Oh well, we tried.
customer_reviews.author: C. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Birds love them
customer_reviews.text: These berries are the main diet of both our birds. They both love them and get excellent health reports. If your bird cannot or will not hold them in his tallons, they are very easy to smash up.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Decker

customer_reviews.title: My grey parrot's favorite treat
customer_reviews.text: We follow the latest guidelines on feeding our 26 year old African Grey Parrot, - which includes varied protein, vegetables, grains and fruit... and he is a good eater (not all parrot owners can say that). But his favorite treat (upon which we can depend in stress situations, such as travel, or not enough "out of cage time" on a particular day) are these nutriberries. He will never turn them down... and they are far more balanced than nuts. Bravo Lafeber!
customer_reviews.author: Janine Kilty

customer_reviews.title: Stale
customer_reviews.text: The bottom half of the Nutri-Berries were a solid mass, which makes them unusable. This is a "no return item", so will start buying locally.
customer_reviews.author: LARRY G

customer_reviews.title: Addictive.
customer_reviews.text: My cockatoo Mimi loves these. I have to ration her to two a day. My other birds also like them, but Mimi is crazy about them .
customer_reviews.author: Kay Martin

customer_reviews.title: Ricci Votes, YES MOM
customer_reviews.text: Ricci loves his Nutri-berries. I use them more for a treat than for his regular diet, but he knows when I pull the lid off.
customer_reviews.author: Shelby Bayard

customer_reviews.title: Quality Bird Food
customer_reviews.text: 2017 expiration date on label. Delivered super fast. Good quality parrot food. BUT DON'T WAIT UNTIL YOU ARE ABOUT OUR OF FOOD. Amazon sent the NutriBerries for Cockatiels by mistake. My Grey does not like it, and will only eat the one labeled Parrot. So I had to re-order and wait longer for correct food to arrive.
customer_reviews.author: mcc

customer_reviews.title: Birds love their Nutriberries!
customer_reviews.text: Birds love these! They don't mind going back into their cage when they know they get this treat. And good nutrition for them. I have three conjures that are about 25 years old who love these nutriberries, they are a major part of their diet and have been for many years. Nutriberries have gone way up in price these last few years so I now buy in bulk through Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Susan McF

customer_reviews.title: Parrots love this food, and it is good for them.
customer_reviews.text: My African Grey and Spectacled Amazon love this food. They make a lot of racket when I am feeding them.
customer_reviews.author: Gail

customer_reviews.title: JJ loves his food
customer_reviews.text: The little balls of food are perfect for my Amazon Grey parrot can handle easily & he loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Vic M.

customer_reviews.title: My favorite for my ‘too
customer_reviews.text: My Goffins’ staple diet, along with fresh stuff- most of the balls arrive intact, sometimes there’s some broken down into loose seeds/nuts.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Francis

customer_reviews.title: Tasty :)
customer_reviews.text: Our African Red Belly loves these. We love that the container is airtight and keeps his food fresh. We put the container in the freezer for 48 hours before feeding (we find this helps with preventing any seed mouths form invading the house. He likes them, there is a little bit of a strange smell that they have, but it isn't overpowering. After seeing how much food he wastes normally and he likes this I cdan deal with a little funky smell
customer_reviews.author: trandall0123

customer_reviews.title: The bird loves this stuff.
customer_reviews.text: My Grey has been eating this for years and loves it. It has been a very reliable product with a great variety of foods in it. I will keep buying it as love as she loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Born on a Monday

customer_reviews.title: this is the next best thing instead of just giving them the seed like ...
customer_reviews.text: we have 2 rescue conures that refuse to eat pellet in addition to their daily fresh food. this is the next best thing instead of just giving them the seed like their previous owners. its also a great foraging food. easy to stuff into the spokes of a party perch. my rosy loves digging these out.
customer_reviews.author: hayuf

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Our parrot loves this food and it keeps him healthy and strong (He is over 35 years old). It is however expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Jean

customer_reviews.title: A very nice treat
customer_reviews.text: I have five parrots and they love these! They are a nice treat for them
customer_reviews.author: Jean Barnicoat

customer_reviews.title: There is nearly zero waste. I put them in her foraging boxes to ...
customer_reviews.text: My Moluccan cockatoo LOVES these. Though they seem a bit expensive, they are actually much less so than other quality pellet foods since she actually eats them all rather than take a bite and drop them or just sweep them from her bowl to the bottom of her cage. There is nearly zero waste. I put them in her foraging boxes to keep her entertained as well as nutritiously fed. Total win-win.
customer_reviews.author: SoundMind

customer_reviews.title: A great product
customer_reviews.text: Picture perfect each nugget flawless In my car on your loves them.
customer_reviews.author: daniel poindexter

customer_reviews.title: please be careful feeding too much of this product
customer_reviews.text: It's a treat. Not a food. After feeding this too much to my African grey she developed an enlarged heart and liver disease
customer_reviews.author: luna

customer_reviews.title: My Meyer's Cries for Them
customer_reviews.text: Actually, my 16-year old much cossetted and spoiled Meyer's parrot loves them. He cries if we don't put three or four a day in his treat box even if we give him assorted seeds, fresh fruits, basmati brown rice and kidney beans and fresh vegetables and herbs which I cook for him every four or five days, and left overs. So, I guess these must be tasty.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sun Conure & African Grey Love It
customer_reviews.text: After finding out the seed mixes weren't great and our very called our African Grey a "fattie," we decided to try this. They are very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Todd M

customer_reviews.title: Will buy this again and again!
customer_reviews.text: Our parrot loves this stuff. They are ball shaped, so they are easy to handle.
customer_reviews.author: Conniek Germini

customer_reviews.title: Best value available
customer_reviews.text: Tired of paying way too much at the local pet stores for this product, I opted for the 20# value box. (store is $29.00 per 3#) Same quality as the store bought. Packaged in a very large zip-lock plastic bag - not in a container as pictured - which is not a problem; the zip-lock bag works fine. My parrot is loving this! I use them in her foraging wheel. Great value. I will continue to buy them in this quantity.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: but he seems to love them.
customer_reviews.text: My Amazon Loves these. I give him 1 a day as a treat which he quickly shreds. I'm not sure how much of it he eats since the majority ends up on the cage floor, but he seems to love them.
customer_reviews.author: L. Jones

product_meta.title: LAFEBER'S Classic Nutri-Berries Pet Bird Food, Made with Non-GMO and Human-Grade Ingredients, for Parrots
product_meta.description: Size:3.25 lbsOur Classic Nutri-Berries avian diet is a nutritionally complete foraging food for parrots. Give a fresh bowl of Nutri-Berries each day as a complete food or as a nutritious snack. They offer all the vitamins, minerals, amino acids and antioxidants to live a long and healthy life while also providing your bird with important beak play and exercise. We hull the seeds and then coat them with stabilized vitamins and chelated minerals so that your bird receives the balanced nutrition they need, just like with pelleted diets. Plus, unground seeds provide the benefits of whole foods like birds have in the wild. Based in the US, we're a second-generation-family-and-veterinarian-owned company in the farmlands of Illinois. All our foods use human-grade, non-GMO, and high-quality ingredients.
feature_bullets: NUTRITIONALLY COMPLETE FORAGING PARROT FOOD: formulated by top avian veterinarians and avian nutritionists; offers twice the foraging of pellets and the same complete nutrition
SUPERIOR SHAPE FOR FORAGING: the round Nutri-Berries shape offers important beak play and exercise, which helps prevent bird boredom and feather picking
NON-GMO AND HUMAN-GRADE INGREDIENTS: no artificial colors, flavors, or preservatives
RICH IN ANTIOXIDANTS & OMEGA 3&6 BALANCED: help support healthy skin, feathers, and immune system
100% SATISFACTION GUARANTEE: we are a small family company that works hard to produce gourmet pet bird food, which is why we're confident in offering a 100% satisfaction guarantee
